lead_paragraph: British authors and publishers are not excessively cheerful at present. Paper and other material are scarce and high. Taxes are heaven-high. Noses may be as thick as ever at the booksellers' windows, but too few go in. Yet books continue to be published. Buyers are found.
abstract: Ed on Brit Book News on recent pubs
